page.title: 09Laversdale School
page.content: Laversdale Church of England School was opened in 1865 and the building was used without major alteration until 1952. It then became impossible for the managers and trustees to maintain the school with the money at their disposal. A great increase in population was said to bring into the school more children than the building could accommodate. (One room of 630 sq.ft. and one of 290 sq.ft.) The building was then out of date and incapable of extension or effective adaptation. Plans were produced for extra buildings of a temporary kind, but the school subsequently closed as it could not match the new standards being set in the rest of the county.
